records.where_clear: Samos hotspot and Vathy town, Greece
records.context_note: Continuous disturbances in Samos hotspot. Migrants started fire when seeing transportation van. Another group descended from camp to Vathy town to protest bad living conditions at reception centre, heading towards HCG premises. HP is closely monitoring the situation. Situation came back to normal around 19:00 LT in Vathy town and 20:00 LT in Samos hotspot. HP managed to transport all migrants to the hotspot and a team could start fingerprinting activities.
records.evidence_quote: JO Poseidon 2019 - Continuous disturbances in Samos hotspot

records.context_note: Protest against Frontex at Samos island. The protest was organized by the local community and authorities, likely to take place either at noon or afternoon. The call was initially published by the Mayor of Eastern Samos on his Facebook profile, mentioning the security and protection of borders as a democratic right and Frontex's obligation to serve this principle. The mayor also called on the government to speed up transfers to the Greek mainland to relieve pressure on the camp, as 6,000 migrants rely on accommodation designed for less than 700, with rapid inflows from Turkey.
records.evidence_quote: Protest against Frontex at Samos island

records.context_note: On 14 October at 21:00, a fight between different groups of migrants started at Samos. In addition, a big fire occurred in the area. It was reported by the media and verbally confirmed by locals and police officers that the fight started in Vathy, involving 2 groups of migrants, one with Syrian origins that was attacked with knives by another composed of Afghanistan nationals. 3 people were stabbed and transported to the hospital. The conflict moved to the camp where police was forced to respond with tear gas. There is no information on the circumstances the fire started. No injured people were reported due to the fire.
records.evidence_quote: Big fire in Samos Island and fights between groups of migrants

records.context_note: Protesting migrants have set fire inside and outside the Moria camp, demanding to be transferred to the mainland. Approximately at 17.20 the fire in the camp started. The fire expanded to another 7 containers. One woman (AFG) died in the fire. Migrants clashed with the police and fire fighters finally successfully extinguished the blaze. Several people were brought to the hospital. On 30.09.2019 Police from Piraeus is coming to help to solve the situation. In the morning of 30.09.2019, the situation was considered under control and FX staff carried on their duties.
records.evidence_quote: Migrants at Moria camp light fires, clash with police

records.location_details: near Chios island, area north of Oinousses
records.where_clear: North of Oinousses, near Chios island, Greece
records.context_note: A capsized boat was detected in the area north of Oinousses (near Chios island). 12 persons have been rescued and 2 corpses have been recovered. One of the rescued migrants stated that there were initially 18 persons on board and that 4 are missing. A search and rescue operation was launched by the Greek Navy and a Frontex asset, while more vessels were heading to the same area to assist in the efforts. At 13:45 LT HCG was informed that all missing 4 persons were found dead under the capsized boat. The bodies were taken on board and will be brought to Chios port. One facilitator (TUR) was arrested by HCG. This incident is under investigation of HCG Crime Investigation Unit.
records.evidence_quote: 2 corpses recovered and 4 persons missing near Chios island

records.context_note: A call related to a possible landing in Kokkari area was responded to, and a boat with 13 migrants (SYR) was discovered. A female migrant (SYR, age 60-70) was discovered already dead in the boat. The rest of the migrants claimed that she was dead an hour before landing. The body was transported to Samos hospital, the rest of the migrants to R.I.C. Samos. Police investigation ongoing.
records.evidence_quote: One dead body was found in Samos in a boat

records.context_note: On 24 August, at 21:30, 3 Afghan minors (14 and 15 years old) started fighting in Moria RIC and one of them died after being stabbed. The other two migrants have been injured and were transferred to Mytilini hospital. Police investigation on-going.
records.evidence_quote: Minor killed in Moria RIC - Lesvos

records.where_clear: Proximity area of Agathonisi island, Samos, Greece
records.context_note: During a patrolling mission in the proximity area of Agathonisi island, Samos, a Frontex team (tender) was asked to identify some Turkish fishing vessels fishing inside of the GTW. At 13:32 LT, a Turkish CPB approached them conducting hostile maneuvers versus the Frontex asset, inside of GTW. The Frontex asset was forced to change heading (turned right inside Greek territorial waters, making a circle) in order to avoid a possible collision with the TCG patrol boat. Samos LCC was informed and the incident was presented on 23 July. The TUR Patrol boat entered the GTW while the Frontex asset was identifying 06 TUR fishing vessels inside GTW. The dangerous maneuvers made by the TUR Patrol boat put at risk the safety of the crew.
records.evidence_quote: Hostile maneuvers by TUR patrol vessel vs Frontex asset

records.where_clear: Hospital (location not specified, likely within operational area)
records.context_note: A Frontex staff member went to the hospital last evening because of a throat inflammation. This morning at 2am a surgery of tonsillitis (amigdalite) was performed. He stayed last night in the hospital and this morning at 2am a surgery of tonsillitis (amigdalite) was performed.
records.evidence_quote: Text Removed - Justification 4, went last evening to the hospital because of a throat inflammation, this morning at 2am a surgery of tonsillitis (amigdalite) was performed.

records.location_details: East of Lesvos, Pamfila sea area, east side of Lesvos island
records.where_clear: Pamfila sea area, east of Lesvos island, Greece
records.context_note: On 11 June 2019, at 06:45, a capsized boat was spotted by a Frontex asset at Pamfila sea area, east side of Lesvos island. A SAR operation was launched. HCG confirmed that so far, 57 migrants have been rescued and 07 dead bodies have been recovered (4 women, 1 man and 2 children). All of them have been transferred. The SAR operation is still ongoing for the possible detection of other persons.
records.evidence_quote: Capsized boat, East of Lesvos. 57 migrants rescued and 07 dead bodies recovered
